port_scanner.probe module¶

This module provides functions and a class PortProbe to connect over a single TCP socket on a specified port, and determine the status of the port on the host on the otherside.

class port_scanner.probe.PortProbe(ip_addr, port)[source]¶

Bases: object

This class connects over a socket on initialization, and provides an analyze() method to determine the status of the port on the other side.

Parameters:
  • ip_addr (str) – IP address of host to connect to. If a hostname is given instead of an IP address, behavior is undefined.
  • port (int) – Port to connect to.
file_no¶

int – The file descriptor of the associated socket.

port¶

int – The remote port of the associated socket.

analyze()[source]¶
close()[source]¶
port_scanner.probe.connect(sock, address)[source]¶

Asynchronously connect over a provided TCP socket.

Parameters:
  • sock (socket.socket) – Socket to connect over.
  • address (tuple) – (ip_addr, port) tuple to connect to.
Raises:

socket.error – If error encountered not normally found with asynchronous connections.
port_scanner.probe.create_tcp_socket()[source]¶

TCP socket factory.

port_scanner.probe.setup_tcp_socket(sock)[source]¶

Set up a TCP socket for asynchronous calls, and to close connections with RST instead of FIN handshakes.
